website_summaries.verdict: Mega Bloks are a great big block that are safe for toddlers, but are still fun for kids as they grow.
pros: Safe size for kids still putting everything in their mouth
Stick together and come apart easily
Comes in a sturdy bag for storage
Still fun to play with even after kids get big enough for smaller building blocks
cons: Blocks do not stay together as well as some other building blocks

website_summaries.verdict: An essential starter set for babies that’s certain to stimulate their imagination.
pros: This affordable set features a variety of colorful blocks in different sizes that are easy for little hands to grasp
Endless possibilities for building and stacking
Comes with a handy zippered storage bag
cons: Good idea to teach “cleanup time” lessons early

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: Opened up the bag of bloks and was surprised to find what appears to be mold inside one of them. Totally disappointed. My toddler was going to play with these, now I can't trust them.
customer_reviews.author: L. E. VanDyke

customer_reviews.title: I bought these blocks for my son for his birthday ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these blocks for my son for his birthday. The first time we played with them, I dumped the bag on the floor to take out the blocks. I look up and see my son spit something out and it was one of the rings pictured! The tiny rings do not go to anything - no idea why or how they got into the bag. My son could have choked. Inspect the bag before playing with these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 14-month-old loves them but can't use'em quite yet
customer_reviews.text: 14 months old, she can't really build things, yet, but she likes emptying the bag, and picking up pieces, and occasionally she gets some connected. In a couple of months it'll be a different story, she's catching on quickly. Not sure about the people who said they were too small and their infant would swallow them; you can see the size of the single pieces in my daughter's hands, they're too big for her to get in her mouth at 14 months and she's like the 98th percentile for height.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: They’re SOOOO LOOSE!!! I bought TWO bags and none of the blocks stick together, and everything my child builds falls apart easily ! Very hard for him to play with. I’d return them if I knew how to! Created a lot of frustration for my child.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: They are large enough to easily see and avoid stepping on
customer_reviews.text: Pro: On one hand, they do give the baby something to throw/do. They are large enough to easily see and avoid stepping on. They don't hurt as much as legos when you accidentally step on them anyway. Con: But on the other hand, they are pretty bad for actual building, because the connections are so terrible. Some of the blocks have a proper fit and do a better job of staying connected, but that is not true for the majority. Most of them have bad connections and won't even hold up their own weight.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: The blocks fit together too loosely.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know If it’s normal and purposely made so that the blocks fit together loosely. If he tries to pick up his tower it falls apart. He is 18 months old and can build a basic unplanned structure. He gets frustrated when it crumbles so easily. Fitting a smidgen tighter would still allow him to put them together easily but they wouldn’t fall part at the drop of a hat or in the case a block. They are smooth and sturdy with bright wonderful colors. The blocks arrived on time in a sturdy zippered bag for storage. I thought that we would love them but so far they are more of a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Regretful purchase
customer_reviews.text: This came with 20 (yes, really) single blocks, which are unusable for building anything. It came with 18 useless top blocks, and only TWO square blocks! I regret wasting my money on these. Now I have to purchase ones that my son can actually build with.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: bright and easy to understand and help your childs mind grow creative!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son when he turned 1 but he really started using them now that he's about 2 years and a half. the colors are really bright, the blocks are large and its easy for him to understand and build but I feel like he's learning and building something new every day!! its one of my favorite things to buy for kids. each one of my siblings (I have 5) including myself have all had a set in our childhood and I would buy one for my daughter too! CREATIVITY IS EVERYTHING! ill update this review with pictures and maybe a video :)
customer_reviews.author: Deam Robore

customer_reviews.title: Both Son and Mom love these!!
customer_reviews.text: Our toddler loves these Mega Blocks. They are sturdy and we've had them a while now and they still work as good as new. Super easy to clean and no choking hazards. The bright colors attract my sons attention and he loves building and also taking everything apart. They work perfect with the Lego table we purchased with it. The bag they come in is perfect for storing the legos and transporting them around. The bag is also useful for entertaining our son as he loves dumping stuff out. I enjoy that my son is learning colors, building skills, and his imagination is growing. I also love using them (yes I'm an adult mother) but they are super fun.
customer_reviews.author: ZeldaBarbie99

customer_reviews.title: Buy Duplo instead... these don’t snap together well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a Valentine gift for my grandsons ages 2&4. I bought them 2 bags of 80s. It was less expensive or maybe a $1.00 more than the big bag of 150. The biggest negative is that they don’t “snap” together well. They alread have several sets that were given to them as gifts, so l wanted to add to what they had already . If l had to start from scratch, l would have spent more money for the LEGO/Duplo brand. I’m shocked that Fisher Price would sell/ produce such a poorly made product!!!
customer_reviews.author: D.Jupiter

customer_reviews.title: Work well alone but not mixed with the pink set.
customer_reviews.text: We have the pink set from kid #1 and needed another bag of them to have enough to play with. I bought the classic colors this time, and they do NOT work well with the pink set. You would think they would all be interchangeable and work well together, but they don't. At all. Now we have two sets of blocks but can still only build with one set at a time. I am so disappointed. As an individual product, it's great for small kids, but I can't get over the fact that they don't work with other colored sets.
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: good for growing baby/toddler
customer_reviews.text: i bought these blocks in preparation for my growing baby! I have a 4 month old, and even though he is not quite ready to play "build" with these blocks, they are a great product to start him on... when he gets older we'll probably upgrade to legos, but These Mega Blocks are great for babies that put everything in their mouths! easy to grip as well. and "fun for the parents!"
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Rolland

customer_reviews.title: USED item!  Some of the blocks had TEETH MARKS on them! Disgusting!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy from this seller. These are USED Mega Blocks being sold as new. All of my blocks were scuffed up and clearly used. The bag was scuffed up as well. Many of the blocks had TEETH MARKS in them from other children/ dogs (who knows?!) CHEWING on them. This seller should be banned from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: K Davey

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 16 month old. We had a blast for 2 hours this morning building and knocking it down over and over!!!! Definitely worth every penny! Update: this is my sons new favorite toy!! It’s mine too ,TBH! lol we have so much fun building and stacking. I am thinking of buying 2 more just so we can build a bunch of towers and then roll our trucks into them and knock them down!!! Because one tower is fun to knock down so I can imagine how fun it would be to destroy a whole bunch of them!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor McCurdy

customer_reviews.title: Dirty
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I'm giving this 1 star is because it is REQUIRED, I wouldn't give this item any stars because it doesn't deserve any. The inside of the bag was extremely dirty and had hair in it. HAIR!! I must have pulled at least 3 hairs from the block bag. DISGUSTING! That can't be healthy. I saw some reviews about the blocks not sticking to each other.... and it's so true. They don't attach nicely, kept falling off. I personally didn't like the size of the blocks either... they are too big. I am definitely returning this item back. Save your money and time and don't purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Mango House

customer_reviews.title: Great for a 2 year old!!
customer_reviews.text: Son loves this building set. There were some complaints here that the pieces fit loosely and that is true but that is intentional. These are made for small kids and if they weren’t a little loose small kids can’t pull them apart. This is just perfect for a 2 year old as he can build and pull them apart himself. Of course lifting up the built set is dicey as the pieces are a little loose and the whole thing could collapse. Wish it had wheels or other interesting pieces these things used to have when I was growing up.
customer_reviews.author: Denis A.

customer_reviews.title: Mega means mega
customer_reviews.text: This is a case of truth in advertising. I got this as a gift, and was pleasantly surprised by how big the bag was when it arrived. There is something primal about a bag of Mega blocks really being one of the biggest gifts under the Christmas tree this year. The package itself is very convenient for lugging around the large but light blocks. And the blocks themselves do, in fact, connect easier than Legos - so as a precursor set for the baby, this is the ideal way to go to get building with the baby.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for kids!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old daughter got these as a gift and when my nephew came over he was obsessed with playing with them. He’s 18 months old and I purchased these for him for Christmas. They are a great gift for children of all ages, but specially for kids 4 and under. My daughter loves to build things with these blocks. Great educational piece as well! I also love that it comes with a bag with a handle for all the pieces to be stored when not in use. The colors of the blocks are great. This is really a problem made to last!
customer_reviews.author: Adam M.

customer_reviews.title: Great blocks for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 20 month old boy and was an instant hit! Kept his attention for so long with the endless possibilities. He’s just trying to figure them out right now which is great. We have magna tiles and he hasn’t quite got the hang of those plus they are easily destructible when pushed over which can create an upset. These are large, durable and easy for them to push together with their sturdy size. Like that it comes with nice carrying bag as well. Great staple toy!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Stenson

customer_reviews.title: Good engaging toy for infant
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice toy for infants. Big enough pieces which they cannot accidentally swallow. These are nice bright color pieces and rather intuitive to play with. Comes with a bag to clean up once done - will recommend for anyone age 1+, however, still under adult supervision.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: A perfect toy for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: The best toy ever for an 18 month old boy. After I get a quick hug, my grandson comes in from his toy chest carrying the bag of these mega building blocks so we can build a tower. They are the perfect size for him. Every time he builds a tower I see him get better and better in "construction strategy." I like that they come in a zippered storage bag, they are too big to swallow, and they fit together easy enough for a child his age to handle. It seems that the plastic material is clean and relatively indestructible. A wonderful toy!
customer_reviews.author: J. Mgebroff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to play with
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why teething is a rating category on this review, but I will say that I don’t really have chocking concerns — they are big. My son wasn’t building blocks when I bought these. He was only interested in knocking stuff down. He got into these right away. At 15 months, he’s still young for them, but they will be a great toy for a few years to come. Really good purchase. I’m so glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa K.

customer_reviews.title: We love these blocks!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using Mega Bloks far before I found them on Amazon. My kids are 5 & 6 and still love them!! I got them each a bag of 80 for around $14.99 I think. The price was great, they arrived quicker than expected (extended delivery date given due to Covid-19). The bag is sturdy to put the bloks back in, zips easy, has a handle for my kids to carry, and fits perfectly with my kid's other Mega Bloks!! I would definitely recommends and buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Sammi B

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for kids and adults alike
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to curb my aluminum chewing addiction and to build some killer block fortresses, but the former was a huge disappointment. I chewed right through a block and swallowed a huge chunk. I gave it another go and next thing I know I had eaten a baker's dozen. Very weak plastic that an adult can easily pierce without much bite force. Also it is very hard to digest. I'm fairly certain I have a Hoover Dam situation going on down there. Anyways I'm giving it a 4 out of 5 because the.subsequent visit to the hospital resulted in a chance encounter with my future wife. We'll be married next June. Thank you chewy blocks!
customer_reviews.author: Fredo el potato

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: My kiddo really appreciated the special shaped pieces that came with this. The bright colors are whimsical. I like that it comes with it's own container to keep them all in, it makes clean up a snap. The over-sized blocks are easier for my little guy to grab. The one thing I really hate about them is that they don't firmly stick together when stacked. This makes his precarious little structures come down before he can really build them up.
customer_reviews.author: Chryssy

customer_reviews.title: So fun
customer_reviews.text: This block set is so much fun to play with. My one year old loves to take apart structures and shapes we build and, within days, figured out how to stack them so there's a great learning opportunity there. We also point out numbers (this has 2 pegs) and colors (this block is blue) as we play and the baby repeats after us. They are not as painful as small legos to step on, but the zipper bag makes it so much easier to clean up and stow away.
customer_reviews.author: MM8

customer_reviews.title: Little one loves these
customer_reviews.text: I am not expecting these blocks to last a hundred years with the little one putting the pieces together and taking them apart over and over. But they have stood up to the abuse quite well thus far and have been the favorite toy at the Grandparent's house. Admittedly I have played with them too, but my home replica was quickly demolished by running child and bouncing puppy in chase. Never have to worry about small parts being swallowed. Never worry about breaking and sharp edges. Best little bag of blocks I could ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Wacky Tacky

customer_reviews.title: Number 1 blocks
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a great buy! The blocks are perfect size: not big - not small. Great variety of colors and blocks styles. There are a lot of things you can build using these blocks. I as a primary user can confirm that ;) since my 17 months kid can't really build stuff. However he helps me to collect them into the bag which great thing to learn - helping others and cleaning after yourself!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great starter set for smaller childern, fosters imaginative play
customer_reviews.text: Great for small hands! Mega blocks are a great starting point for kids interested in legos, but still too small for duplo. Foster imaginative play and creativity! We got my son this one bag, it is easy to clean up and he really enjoys them. When he was younger, he just wanted to build towers and stack, so one bag was enough. As he has gotten older, we have had to add to our set to allow for more creative building.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong with these blocks
customer_reviews.text: I gifted this to a one year old. Everyone was “oohing and aahing” at what a good idea. The child happened to receive another, identical one and instead of anyone being disappointed that he got a repeat gift it made it better bc he has twice as many blocks to build with. You cannot go wrong with this toy. This is the kind of toy that can grow with him for a few years. As a one year old he won’t be building anything but he can continue to build and learn and play for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Struckie

customer_reviews.title: Always a favorite of mine!
customer_reviews.text: I gave no stars on teething because I have no idea why one would use these as a teething toy. However, these blocks have always been something I enjoy getting. My 7 year old had them when she was younger and now I got some for my 1.5 year old who loves them. My 7 year old still enjoys playing with them with her sister. These are perfect toys for kids to use their imagination and have hours of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Great for growing kids!
customer_reviews.text: My son is crazy about these blocks. Keeps him entertained and definitely helps him build his motor and creativity skills. I got them for him for Christmas and this huge bag of blocks was a great one. The blocks are just large enough I don't have to worry about him swallowing them because he's still very young, and it's encouraging a growing level of play for him that I was really hoping for. He pretty much loves all his toys but always comes back to his blocks.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Loose fit but still fun for younger kids.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves them and there are quite a lot for the price. However they don't fit together very well. He gets very upset when his tower falls apart when he tries to pick it up to show anyone. They are sized right for little hands and I guess being able to easily get them apart would work well for younger kids or those who have trouble. However both my 2 year old and I wish they fit together just a little tighter. Overall decent toy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Doolin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome building block
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking something like this! It’s good LEGO equivalents for toddler. The pieces are big enough that you don’t have to worry about chocking. This is good for my son to develop his creativity.... when my son open this his reaction wooooow. He loves it!the product has a high quality feels to it and the bag can be used for storage bag! Which is a huge plus
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Tendean

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for 12 months old!!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 months son loves it!! It is a great toy for learning colors, building blocks, and for playing around with the various blocks. The only thing missing is an instruction book with different things you can build with the provided blocks. I guess I am used to LEGO ;)
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Best Blocks for Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My grandson and I have so much fun with these. We build robots, towers, fences, then we sort them into to colors and count them. It is a good thing that they don't stick together like Legos, because when your toddler decides to throw them, the whole robot doesn't go flying. Think of them as stacking blocks. We love them. My grandson has played with them since he was 1 year, now he's 3.
customer_reviews.author: Flutefingers

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for a 1 yr old
customer_reviews.text: These are really fun with my 1 yr old. He loves if I build something so he can destroy it. They are durable. They’re also big so no choking hazard. It’s been fun watching him learn and practice how to put the pieces together to build something. Very happy I bought these. I also love that it comes in a reusable bag so I don’t have to find a way to store them. Definitely recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Katarina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little hands!
customer_reviews.text: Our 18-month-old loves blocks and building, and this product is perfect. Pieces are relatively easy to put together and pull apart, they're colorful and durable, and come with a storage bag that zips up. Our toddler loves clean-up time, putting all the pieces back in the bag. Great value for the price, especially given all the other much more expensive options on here.
customer_reviews.author: Ioana Rusu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 2 year old daughter because she is always eyeing her older brothers legos. She took to these immediately and sits for an hour playing with them (unusual for a toddler). They are thick plastic and have held up very well...she has thrown to the ground and none have broken/scratched. She loves putting them together then pulling them apart. Her older siblings even like them and have helped her built items. I especially like the part that comes with the wheels because you can actually use it to build a vehicle. Keep in mind that they are large so not many fit in the bag, but enough to make small things.
customer_reviews.author: Torie

customer_reviews.title: USED!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The bag was sealed but the blocks r clearly used! They are all scuffed up and tge bag is in horrible condition but somewhow sealed... nice try! The bag is filthy on the outside.. Returning!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My toddler loves these blocks!
customer_reviews.text: These blocks are the best! Our toddler will spend a half an hour with these (which is a long time in toddler world!) building. They are a great size and the colors are bright and fun. The quantities are a little strange... and I wish there were more regular blocks than the specialty ones but thats a Mega Block thing and not an Amazon thing. Overall a great buy - def. recommend --- especially for the less than $20 price!
customer_reviews.author: APic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift for a 2 Year Old
customer_reviews.text: My two year old nephew received this as a Christmas present from us this year. I had kept him in our nursery at church, and he had played with some there a few weeks prior and loved them so I knew what to get him. After opening them he immediately started stacking blocks and ignored his other gifts. His aunt scored! ;) My son has always loved Legos which are fun and educational, so I wanted to get my nephew started on a love for these fun and educational building toys. These are great for motor skills for younger children too.
customer_reviews.author: L. FarmerTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Odd shapes
customer_reviews.text: These come with a lot of odd shaped pieces which don't work well to build tall towers. We don't like the orange, purple, or light blue pieces. After ordering two of these bags and having another large bag, we have almost a whole bag of just odd pieces. There are also a lot of "half" blocks, where you need two of them to make it the same height as another block.
customer_reviews.author: happy_girl

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves playing with her blocks. I personally love that she is learning how to refine her motor/thinking skills. How would she go about building a tower or an "animal"? What colors does she want to use to make it different than the last tower she built? It's great for both learning and having fun. The carrying bag is such a nice perk! She loves playing with that almost as much as she loves the blocks. It has a durable zipper and has a handle on top to make it easy to lug around. I would highly reccomend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Erin P.

customer_reviews.title: Quality and price are both a win!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit nervous ordering these because there were quite a few reviews mentioning them not having a strong enough connection. I'm very happy to say that the issue seems to be resolved as mine connect very well and take a bit of effort to pull apart. Very very happy with the quality and the price.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Bag o' BloKs
customer_reviews.text: Big BloKs, small BloKs. Blue BloKs, red BloKs. Long BloKs, short BloKs. Everyone loves these BloKsBloKsBloKs!!! Buy these BloKs to support your LO's understanding of shapes, structure, color, and engineering. Realize that you are capable of taking a BloK away from a toddler's hand because "your rainbow BloK tower needed it." These boss BloKs come with a re-usable zipper bag, which your LO will find interesting as you sit in the corner trying to create Tower Bridge out of this pack of 80.
customer_reviews.author: KRS

customer_reviews.title: Papa, Mama, and Baby approved
customer_reviews.text: Our one year old loves playing with these. She’ll put them in her mouth sometimes and we don’t worry at all about choking. They’re easy to stack and take apart. She’s not quite building with them yet, but she’s definitely exploring and learning how to put them together and take them apart. There are only a few things she will play with every day, and this set is one of them. They certainly can make a mess, but it truly takes less than a minute to get them all back in the bag and zip it up. So glad we got this set for our baby’s learning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a tweeting toy...
customer_reviews.text: I would not suggest letting your child teeth on these.. but they are big so they can’t be a choking hazard for little ones and they are pretty durable. Probably not durable for a dog though... My only thing was I wish the bag was just a tad bigger to fit all the pieces easier.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Feelings
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of the blocks and the amount of blocks in the bag BUT many of the pieces are tough to fit together and stay together. They are loose. Not all of them but it gets frustrating when the kid wants to build something and it's unable to make a solid connection between the pieces. Nice set but frustrating. Also, thee plastic smell upon opening was overwhelming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazin Raisin

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES these blocks! And today my 4 year old nephew came over and so we brought these out. Even though my son is 10 months, the two of them played for quite some time with these. I'm so glad I bought them and found some things that bridges the age gap for them to play with each other!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Just like brother's legos but easier to handle
customer_reviews.text: It's been a long-drawn out situation with little brother wanting to play with big brother's legos, but they were too small. These are ideal. They're just the right size for little hands and very colorful. Also, they're easier if you step on then, as compared the smaller ones. A great buy and he loves them!
customer_reviews.author: L. R. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Great for little hands and big imaginations. I think she uses these just as much with her kitchen set as she does building. The bag is great durability to continue to keep blocks in, and the right size for a 1 year old to drag around to put away. We've built houses, robots and a scary giraffe.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Is it appropriate for 17 months old?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one at promotional price. It has not attracted his attention yet. He can build ten blocks most so far, then he gets frustrated when the blocks fall down and gives up. Every time he plays less than three minutes only.I am wondering if it is not appropriate for his age .
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use
customer_reviews.text: Building blocks helps children be creative. Buying this size can prevent choking hazards for small childrens. My baby nephew plays with these blocks and he is 11 months now. And my baby girl plays with these too. She is a year i recommend getting this for your child. As a starter with legos. Or even a daycare center
customer_reviews.author: Cashmere Williams

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Colorful, and a Great Gateway to LEGOs!
customer_reviews.text: My son is a toddler and still not fully into these. He likes taking apart what I've built, and then putting the blocks away. Ha! But in time I can tell he's going to love these. As a parent, I'll say they are an excellent value, very colorful, durable, and there's a nice variety of shapes and sizes for curious little minds. I'm looking forward to my son playing with these more, and then we can move on to LEGOs when he's older.
customer_reviews.author: Willie V. HughesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great Price for durable blocks
customer_reviews.text: This item is great for toddlers my son has had these for 8 months and he initially played with them by throwing them around and he loved the noise they made. Now he understands how to build and his creativity and understanding of colors is developing we use these for counting and recognizing colors. I love it and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole B.

customer_reviews.title: Big Building Bag Blocks
customer_reviews.text: bought for my 2yr old grandson for christmas. He couldn't get the bag open quick enough to play with them. Perfect size for the little hands and for him to use his imagination. Love having the bag to put them all away and transport.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Large Blocks
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Large Blocks as an alternative to legos! My son is two loves these blocks and loves the bag haha. The packaging it comes with is great. I kept it to put blocks away. There are small holes in the bottom to avoid suffocation... which is great, because my son thinks its hilarious to put it on his head because the front side is see through. Overall would really recommend!
customer_reviews.author: TheAllens

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my child busy
customer_reviews.text: This set is great for the money. I also really like that it comes with a reusable bag to store the blocks in. I've purchased two sets, one for our home and one for my in-laws that babysit multiple times a week. Both purchases came with great quality and my son loves them. Keeps him busy for hours!
customer_reviews.author: Leaviathon

customer_reviews.title: Love these blocks
customer_reviews.text: These blocks are great for my toddler. They're big enough so they can chew on them and not choke at all. They're easy to put into the sink to clean off. Baby hands can stack these very easily. Would definitely recommend for any infant or toddler. I bought one for myself and one for a baby shower gift as well.
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: Great toy to encourage child's imagination
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES these blocks. He got them when he was 18 months old and is now nearly 20 months old. They are by far his favorite toy. It's great watching him create and build with these. We have also been using them to teach him colors and he caught on pretty quickly! The bag is super handy for putting them all away after playing. My only complaint is that some of the blocks fit a little looser/tighter than others, which can make it challenging to make a sturdy structure (too loose) or for little hands to get blocks apart (too tight).
customer_reviews.author: AmberTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: 17 month Old Loves Them, although unconventionally.
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for a 17 month old. He didn't want to build with them yet, but thought they were like a ball pool. He would dump them out over and over and play like we were in a ball pit, pushing them around and squeeling! Pros: -Durable. -Colorful. -Multi-purpose. -Comes with own carry case, which is a very nice bonus. Cons: -None that I can see! Great price too!
customer_reviews.author: Bitsy Bogs

customer_reviews.title: Great first blocks
customer_reviews.text: This gift was perfect for our grandson who turned one. He is learning how to build these blocks together. The primary colors are fabulous. Our son loved lego's growing up and was part of Lego competitions when he got to middle school. We're hoping our grandson will enjoy these blocks just as much.
customer_reviews.author: T. St. Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Great durability and fun for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Very durable as my toddler throws them so hard all the time and the pieces are intact. My 20 month old just loves playing with them and is so excited to stack the pieces and show off what he made. Def keeps them busy while you do things around the house
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: some of them don't grip tightly enough
customer_reviews.text: Our toddler loves playing with these when they work as intended. Unfortunately he also loses his mind when some of the pieces simply fall apart because they aren't gripping well. For whatever reason it seems like it's mostly the blue blocks that don't fit together tightly but not exclusively. The ones that go together well he enjoys but the frustration he gets from the others is painful to watch - we've ended up sorting out the "bad" blocks and getting rid of them, unfortunately it's enough of them that I wouldn't buy the set again.
customer_reviews.author: Chain of Command

customer_reviews.title: A little thin but otherwise excellent.
customer_reviews.text: They are a little flimsy, you can step on them and crack the plastic too easily. My daughter is 3 and she stepped on one without looking and the plastic cracked a little. But they are very bright colors, very shiny and connect perfectly to one another. They don't connect very tightly, so they come apart very easily which is great for our kids. The bag they came in is large and durable, perfect for keeping them in and using as part of their chores check list.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kids
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING FOR TODDLERS!!! I have purchase 3 of this LEGO sets. Omg my kids love them so much and they are perfect. We got them on sale $14.99 so we got 1 first to try and as soon as we receive that one; we order 2 more. Kids are very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. VLC

customer_reviews.title: Fun for toddlers and adults
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my son's first birthday. He likes to throw them and out them in his mouth. I'm okay with the latter because most of them are large enough to not worry about him choking. The single-sized ones make me a tad nervous. He likes to watch us build things and then tears them apart. I think once he gets the hang of stacking the pieces himself he will have a lot of fun with these. And I will enjoy tearing his creations apart. Oh and the bag is a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit Loosely
customer_reviews.text: They fit loosely.. Most of them do not stick together well like the small, standard sized Legos. I do Not think this is a seller issue as I’ve bought these exact Mega Blocks from many sources and they all fit loose and fall apart. I think the manufacturer has just lowered their quality.
customer_reviews.author: MollyC

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love these blocks. Great for any age
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kids starting at a very young age and even at 3 years old they enjoy these blocks. I love the amount that comes in this bag because it allows the kids to really have an imagination when playing. They are also big enough so that little babies who love to put things in their mouths they will not choke. Really great quality and really fun to play with even for myself! would definitely recommend !
customer_reviews.author: Lynnette

customer_reviews.title: Not as described in listing.
customer_reviews.text: The blocks in the listing are not what I received. I got the Mega Blocks First Builders and this set does not have the wheel base that is stated in the listing. My grandson is only 14 months so decided a set without a wheel base is OK for his building capabilities. After very little use many of the blocks no longer fit firmly together. This means a tower or anything beyond a few pieces falls over. Expected more from Fisher Price!
customer_reviews.author: Pookiebeardog

customer_reviews.title: Every kid needs these!
customer_reviews.text: From every childhood you’ve ever seen it seems everyone gets these blocks. They have stayed true to who they were for years and I absolutely love them for it. They are strong and sturdy and made for the youngest of kids with no choking hazard. These are also an awesome price for what you get. I always got them for my kids when they we 6 months and even at 3 years old my daughter still enjoys them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Blackford

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: My 1, 3, and 6 year old grand kids all love these blocks. I purchased for the 1 year old and she immediately began to play with them however it wasn't long before the other 2 joined in to build items. It has a perfect amount of blocks and they are easy to attach. Good Buy, it keeps them busy.
customer_reviews.author: Shan William

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves these
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product building toy ever for a toddler. It not only develops coordination but also imagine. These blocks are the perfect size for a toddlers little hands. I have bought two of these for my 2 yr old grandson. One for my house and one for his. Prime shipping also makes purchasing these Mega Blocks so easy and cost effective. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit for mega blocks
customer_reviews.text: We got this when my oldest was 12 months old. It’s the perfect quantity to start out with for a young toddler. These are much easier for a little toddler to manipulate than Duplo blocks. My oldest is 4 now and she still enjoys playing with these.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Blocks are great!
customer_reviews.text: My kid (12 mo) LOVES these blocks. They are perfect for little hands and I can see the little wheels in his head turning as he learns about shapes and building and problem solving. BUT I wish I had gone with the Lego Duplo because the size of the rounded tops are perfect for him to suck on and he wanders around the house trying to use them as pacifiers. As a result, a lot of the single block pieces are now slightly misshapen and don't hold well to other pieces. I've noticed the tops of the Lego Duplo blocks are different and I think he would find them less appealing as makeshift pacifiers.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: This toy is a great amount of fun for everyone
customer_reviews.text: This toy is a great amount of fun for everyone, regardless of age. We got this when my LO was little over 1 year & she still enjoys playing with it. She likes to put them together and pull them apart. They are the perfect size for 1-2 yr oldies (and older) eventhough it says for older kids. These blocks definitely help them to advance fine motor skills.These help children with hand & eye coordination as they are playing.They help children to recognize the primary colors in early age & then building different objects when they get little older I would highly recommend these blocks. Very satisfied with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: S J

customer_reviews.title: Fun Educational Toy
customer_reviews.text: I have a preschooler, toddler, and baby. Basically I need a toy my kids can build with, but the baby won't get hurt with. These are easy to wash, and really fun to build with. They don't hurt to step on like Legos. **Don't do it if you can avoid though. They provide lots of entertainment for my kids and I as well as help with development. They are quality, and I got a cheap brand once and they were awful. Megabloks are the best honestly. Fun colors to identify and to practice counting with.
customer_reviews.author: Zebragirl

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints. This was a good value for the number blocks - a lot of different colors and sizes. My one year-old really enjoys them and they seem very durable. No complaints about the quality and I appreciate having a bag to put them all in once play is over.
customer_reviews.author: Deep in the Heart of Texas

customer_reviews.title: Best blocks for a toddler!
customer_reviews.text: My child loves these blocks and she's 18 months. She has a love for building up and down and even my 7 month joins in on the fun! I love that the blocks are big too...so no accidents are bound to happen with swallowing them. Going to order a bigger bag next time. I think it was several more dollars but it'll be worth it since you can join them all together.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Tomez-Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bright colors and easy to manipulate with small hands
customer_reviews.text: They're colorful, bright, stick together well, easy for young hands to manipulate. My 15 m/o can put a few pieces together on her own but what she enjoys most is when mom or dad build something. Once our masterpieces are complete our toddler likes to play the role of Godzilla and annihilate all that stands in her way. Of course when she's done she brings the pieces back to mom or dad to put back together and the cycle repeats.
customer_reviews.author: MTE

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great quality
customer_reviews.text: Love these mega bloks! My 18 mo only son loves to build and knock these down alllll day. The price is very similar to what Walmart sells them at, in fact I think that is who is distributing it because ours came in a Walmart box. But they came packaged fine and all the pieces were in their. So far they have gone together really well, in the beginning it was hard to get them apart, but as time has passed it has become easier to take them apart and put them together. I am highly satisfied with our purchase of these mega bloks.
customer_reviews.author: Savanah Walk

customer_reviews.title: Hours of entertainment
customer_reviews.text: My toddler Loves these blocks. I plan to purchase another bag as she is moving towards making much bigger things. She gets frustrated when there aren't enough to finish. This is such a great toy for any child. Even my 6 year old, while has moved on to tiny building blocks, loves building with the big blocks as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gram Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Great blocks for little hands
customer_reviews.text: Great block set for your little one! Colorful and way to hold and build for little hands. Has so many blocks and they can so so much with it. I love that it comes with a bag. Great for travel too! Best part is it doesn’t hurt when you step on them =)
customer_reviews.author: mheartsn

customer_reviews.title: Good starter blocks
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about these blocks except not all of the blocks stay connected. I don’t understand why but my kiddos were very frustrated when they had to reconstruct the blocks over and over. That’s the reason for the three stars.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price! Packaging needs work.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for the neighbors kids for Christmas. They seem to enjoy playing with them. My only complaint is that with the packaging, there were a lot of bumps in the carrying bag from the blocks. Looked almost like it was used which is totally not how I wanted to give a gift.
customer_reviews.author: StL_Queen

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for young kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter when she started to roll around. Her cousin had these and she loved putting them in her mouth, so I bought this set. She has played with these every day since we got them. She loves putting them together and taking them apart. There is one piece that you can put wheels on and she loves building onto that and pushing that around. These are a great staple in the assortment of toys any child has. And I love that it has a bag with a zipper for storage (though our dog later destroyed the bag). She plays with these just about every day.
customer_reviews.author: jmcc33

customer_reviews.title: Bright and fun! Great toy beginners building creativity
customer_reviews.text: These blocks are perfect for my little one. Colors are bright, and the bloks are not to difficult to attach and remove. I hope these hold up! The plastic is not very hard which I guess is good for a young age, in terms of possible teething or any possible ‘throwing games’.
customer_reviews.author: Momma13

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: great product !!!! I haven't found a child yet that didn't love Mega Blocks! My kids played with them and I bought these for my grandgirls. There are no sharp edges. They are extremely easy to clean. The kids get to exercise their imaginations and build whatever they want. The bag they come in is so well built. I still have a couple bags left from the old days (10-15 years ago) when my kids played with them. I use them as Christmas storage bags. Lol You can't beat the price. The quality is amazing. This is a no brainer gift.
customer_reviews.author: Hicham

customer_reviews.title: Dirty blocks
customer_reviews.text: Several pieces had some sort of grease or oil on them. I cleaned the pieces for fear of dangerous chemicals getting into my children’s mouths
customer_reviews.author: Maumann

customer_reviews.title: Great for little kids
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these as a gift for a 1.5 year old. He loved them. Not sure about the durability of the bag them come in. I did also gift a plastic bin to put them in after he plays with them. They are a great size for little fingers to play with. Would recommend them and would consider purchasing another set as a gift in the future if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves these blocks! Purchased when she was about 14 months old and she liked them but it was fun to see her connect the dots to learn how to put them together and build something. My nephew still loves these and he's almost 4 so I'm looking forward to these guys lasting a while!
customer_reviews.author: Alysha Moder

customer_reviews.title: Easy for a young child to hold
customer_reviews.text: I have these as a gift and they loved them! I like that it came in a bag. It makes it easy to clean all of the blocks up. They fit well together. I do wish the bag was a little thicker because I fear it won’t hold up for long. They are easy to hold for young kids and I like that they are big enough that you don’t have to worry about them being a chocking hazard
customer_reviews.author: Loyal Customer

customer_reviews.title: good product with nice design.
customer_reviews.text: I like this product when ever my daughter is playing with them and preparing some nice designs with these blocks. and she likes the bag too - every day once she done with playing she cleans all the blocks by placing them into this bag nice and easy :)
customer_reviews.author: Srinivasa Rao

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: It so happened we learned this was the first gift our cousin, age 1 opened at his party. He immediately began to manipulate the blocks which were perfectly sized for his small hands. The container is a bonus for the parents!! Mega blocks are a great introduction to building and blocks and we are certain he will play with it for years which is why we made this purchase..
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with these blocks! Obviously you can't give toddlers the regular small lego blocks because it's a safety hazard for them but you definitely won't have that problem with the size of these blocks. It is great for teething as they are very durable and you won't have a problem with your child breaking them and injuring themselves with them. Because of the size, they are very easy to find and clean up and unlike the regular sized legos, you can't really step on them and injure yourself in the process :)
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers to build with. Easy assembly for kiss
customer_reviews.text: Our twins love these blocks. Yes they chew on them but they build with them as well. If you have toddlers they will spend hours putting these together and than running their trucks in them to crash down the structure they built.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for building minds
customer_reviews.text: We bought these as a gift from our new baby to his big brother. He absolutely loves them and are so nice and easy to stack and take with us with their pouch. I recommend them. They are fun to play with your kids too. All around a good toy. Our son has definitely learned to use his imagination more with these blocks.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: The bottom isn’t suitable for teething, I’m afraid it hurts baby teeth. My 11 months baby loves this toy, after one week, he can build several blocks together. The connection between two blocks is not tight so It’s easy to build and separate for baby. It’s also an excellent choice for family time.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: A lot of pieces and a lot of mess
customer_reviews.text: I really have nothing bad to say about this product. The only thing that I really have to watch out for is when my daughter gets a hold of it and unzips it herself. She likes to dump every piece out when no one is watching. Other that she has a lot of fun with these. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

product_meta.title: Mega Bloks First Builders Big Building Bag with Big Building Blocks, Building Toys for Toddlers (80 Pieces) - Blue Bag
product_meta.description: Endless creativity with 80 award-winning big building blocks! Build, stack, and explore endless construction possibilities with this award-winning set of 80 big building blocks in sweet colors! Now your little one can build anything they imagine when they use the blocks and special shapes to create tall towers, crazy castles, funny animals, or whatever else they dream up! Perfect for little hands, these big blocks fit together and come apart easily, helping your child to develop fine motor skills and creativity over hours of open-ended play. When playtime's over, cleanup is easy with the handy storage bag.
feature_bullets: 80 classic-colored building blocks, including special shapes
Hands-on play for early childhood development
Combine with other Mega Bloks preschool toys and build them up!

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars19,870 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
